channel.title: [REQ] Post Approval
channel.description:
I think there should be a post approval under the server downloads and other sections too.
They seem to get spammed with useless threads about joining leeched Hybrid PvPs and other sources.
If you agree just leave a post behind.

item.title: [REQ] Post Approval
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Moderators obviously don’t even read reports, because I reported a person’s post that was a leech in the server downloads section and attached a note saying there were five more by the same user, and the moderator only locked the leech post I reported.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] Post Approval
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

I suppose but it is just really “pissing/winding” many people up and it is all un-needed when there is a perfectly good status page.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] Post Approval
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

All you will get is a dead section because we have a lazy staff. And because of that 1 or 2 mods do the entire workload.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] Post Approval
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

demps2k9:

There are 3 under the server downloads section with the links still there. If it causes too much for the moderators then maybe it would be best to recruit another 2-3 really active moderators.

Report them, and they’ll get dealt with in a few hours. Even if really active moderators got recruited they would eventually do less anyway, it seems to be an inevitable thing. It would solve the problem in the short term, but not in the long.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] Post Approval
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

There used to be one in the server tutorials, I suppose it caused some change which is sort of noticeable even today but it added quite a lot to the moderators work load I believe, and got removed eventually anyway.

Besides, posts like that get dealt with fairly quickly anyway? All you need to do is report them.

Read full topic
